title: Biden to Sign Federal Disaster Aid for Texas
sub_head: President plans to travel to Texas soon as state grapples with power outages and aftermath of winter weather
body:
WASHINGTON—President Biden said Friday he expects to sign federal disaster assistance for Texas once the governor’s request reaches his desk, seeking to speed up the federal response in the aftermath of extreme winter weather, power outages and utility disruptions in the state.
The president told reporters at the White House following a virtual speech to the Munich Security Conference that he intended to travel to Texas soon but wanted to ensure that he doesn’t create a “burden” for people responding to the crisis on the ground.
A harsh winter storm earlier this week knocked out power to four million people in Texas but on Friday, the Electric Reliability Council of Texas, which operates the state’s electricity grid, said operations were back to normal.
“Conservation is still encouraged,” the grid operator said in a tweet.
As of Friday morning, an estimated 14.4 million Texans were without safe drinking water, according to the Texas Commission on Environmental Quality.
